docs.text: Welcome to vk.py 👋 Fastest, scalable, fully asynchronous. 🏠 Homepage Install pip install https://github.com/prostomarkeloff/vk.py/archive/master.zip --upgrade In requirements.txt: # some stuff https://github.com/prostomarkeloff/vk.py/archive/master.zip Usage A simple example from vk import VK from vk.utils.task_manager import TaskManager import logging logging . basicConfig ( level = "INFO" ) vk = VK ( access_token =< TOKEN > ) async def status_get (): resp = await vk . api_request ( "status.get" ) print ( resp ) if __name__ == "__main__" : task_manager = TaskManager ( vk . loop ) task_manager . add_task ( status_get ) task_manager . run () You can find more examples here Example of use bot framework, with docker integration click Features Rich high-level API. Fully asynchronous. Based on asyncio and aiohttp. Bot framework out of-the-box. Fully typed, thanks to Pydantic. Compatible with PyPy. Have a lot of tools (in bot framework) out-of-the-box for creating largest and powerful applications click : Caching Blueprints Cooldowns FSM (WIP) Alternatives Kutana. Bot engine for creating Telegram and VK bots VKBottle. Bot framework for VK bot development. VK_API. A simple library for accessing VK API. And many other libraries... Author 👤 prostomarkeloff Twitter: @prostomarkeloff Github: @prostomarkeloff 🤝 Contributing Contributions, issues and feature requests are welcome! Feel free to check issues page . Show your support Give a ⭐️ if this project helped you! 📝 License Copyright © 2019 prostomarkeloff . This project is MIT licensed. This README was generated with ❤️ by readme-md-generator
